Package monkey.ai

Class AI<S extends State<S,​A>,​A>

  • java.lang.Object
    • monkey.ai.AI<S,​A>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - The type to be used for game States.
    A - The type of the moves of the game.
    public class AI<S extends State<S,​A>,​A>
extends java.lang.Object
    An AI is a generic, backtracking alpha-beta pruner for a deterministic, turn-taking, two-player, zero-sum game of perfect information. See S. Russell, P. Norvig, Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach, 3rd ed., Prentice Hall, p. 167f.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AI​(Player p, S s0, long t)
      Constructs a new AI for a certain Player given an initial State and a timeout in milliseconds.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      protected A bestNodeLimitedSearch​(int depthLimit)
      When called in a state in which the player has the move, selects one of the legal actions to be played using best node search with limited depth.
      protected boolean cutoffTest​(S s, int d)
      During an alpha-beta search, decides when to apply State.eval(monkey.ai.Player).
      A immediateSearch()
      When called in a state in which the player has the move, selects one of the legal actions to be played using immediate search.
      A iterativeDeepeningSearch()
      When called in a state in which the player has the move, selects one of the legal actions to be played using iterative deepening search.
      protected int maxValue​(S s, int alpha, int beta, int depthLimit)
      Executes a "max" alpha-beta pruning step using depth limited search.
      protected int minValue​(S s, int alpha, int beta, int depthLimit)
      Executes a "min" alpha-beta pruning step using depth limited search.
      protected int nextGuess​(int alpha, int beta, int subtreeCount)
      Suggests a separation value for a best node search.
      protected void timeCheck()
      Asserts the fact that the time is not almost over, or throws an exception if this is not the case.
      void update​(A a)
      Updates the current State with the given action.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AI

        public AI​(Player p,
          S s0,
          long t)
        Constructs a new AI for a certain Player given an initial State and a timeout in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        p - The player the AI will play as.
        s0 - The initial State of the game.
        t - The maximum number of milliseconds usable to select a move.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Any of the arguments are null.
        Since:
        1.0

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update​(A a)
        Updates the current State with the given action.
        Parameters:
        a - A legal action to inform this AI about.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - a is an illegal action for the current state.
        Since:
        1.0

      • iterativeDeepeningSearch

        public A iterativeDeepeningSearch()
        When called in a state in which the player has the move, selects one of the legal actions to be played using iterative deepening search. See S. Russell, P. Norvig, Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach, 3rd ed., Prentice Hall, p. 88f.
        Returns:
        A legal action to be played.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The player does not have the move or if the state is terminal.
        Since:
        1.0

      • immediateSearch

        public A immediateSearch()
        When called in a state in which the player has the move, selects one of the legal actions to be played using immediate search. See the project report.
        Returns:
        A legal action to be played.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The player does not have the move or if the state is terminal.
        Since:
        1.0

      • bestNodeLimitedSearch

        protected A bestNodeLimitedSearch​(int depthLimit)
                           throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        When called in a state in which the player has the move, selects one of the legal actions to be played using best node search with limited depth. See Dmitrijs Rutko, Fuzzified Algorithm for Game Tree Search with Statistical and Analytical Evaluation, in Scientific Papers, vol. 770, 2011, Univerity of Latvia, p. 94f.
        Parameters:
        depthLimit - Maximum depth to be inspected
        Returns:
        A legal action to be played.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - The time limit is almost over.
        Since:
        1.0

      • nextGuess

        protected int nextGuess​(int alpha,
                        int beta,
                        int subtreeCount)
        Suggests a separation value for a best node search. See Dmitrijs Rutko, Fuzzified Algorithm for Game Tree Search with Statistical and Analytical Evaluation, in Scientific Papers, vol. 770, 2011, Univerity of Latvia, p. 95f.
        Parameters:
        alpha - First extreem of the alpha-beta range.
        beta - Second extreem of the alpha-beta range.
        subtreeCount - Number of subtrees that will be tested.
        Returns:
        The suggested separation value.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        bestNodeLimitedSearch(int)

      • maxValue

        protected int maxValue​(S s,
                       int alpha,
                       int beta,
                       int depthLimit)
                throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Executes a "max" alpha-beta pruning step using depth limited search. See S. Russell, P. Norvig, Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach, 3rd ed., Prentice Hall, p. 87f. A transposition table is also used. See D.M. Breuker, J.W.H.M. Uiterwijk, H.J. van den Herik, Information in Transposition Tables, in H.J. van den Herik, J.W.H.M. Uiterwijk (eds), Advances in Computer Chess 8, Computer Science Department, Universiteit Maastricht. 1997, pp. 2-3, 4.
        Parameters:
        s - The state to be considered.
        alpha - The current alpha value. It may be null.
        beta - The current beta value. It may be null.
        depthLimit - Maximum depth to be inspected.
        Returns:
        The utility brought by the most useful action for the AI within s.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - The state is null.
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - The time limit is almost over.
        Since:
        1.0

      • minValue

        protected int minValue​(S s,
                       int alpha,
                       int beta,
                       int depthLimit)
                throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Executes a "min" alpha-beta pruning step using depth limited search. See S. Russell, P. Norvig, Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach, 3rd ed., Prentice Hall, p. 87f. A transposition table is also used. See D.M. Breuker, J.W.H.M. Uiterwijk, H.J. van den Herik, Information in Transposition Tables, in H.J. van den Herik, J.W.H.M. Uiterwijk (eds), Advances in Computer Chess 8, Computer Science Department, Universiteit Maastricht. 1997, pp. 2-3, 4.
        Parameters:
        s - The state to be considered.
        alpha - The current alpha value. It may be null.
        beta - The current beta value. It may be null.
        depthLimit - Maximum depth to be inspected.
        Returns:
        The utility brought by the most useful action for the opponent within s.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - The state is null.
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - The time limit is almost over.
        Since:
        1.0

      • cutoffTest

        protected boolean cutoffTest​(S s,
                             int d)
        During an alpha-beta search, decides when to apply State.eval(monkey.ai.Player). See S. Russell, P. Norvig, Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach, 3rd ed., Prentice Hall, p. 171.
        Parameters:
        s - The state to be considered.
        d - Maximum depth to be inspected
        Returns:
        true just in case State.eval(monkey.ai.Player) should be applied.
        Since:
        1.0

      • timeCheck

        protected void timeCheck()
                  throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Asserts the fact that the time is not almost over, or throws an exception if this is not the case. This can be useful right after a frequent and/or time-consuming operation.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - The time limit is almost over.
        Since:
        1.0
